did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Papers, correspondence, books, diaries, notebooks, scrapbooks, clippings, programs, photographs.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Papers include professional correspondence with colleagues, publishers, and others concerning textbooks; also, her teaching career in general.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Laura Bryant taught singing and music in the Ithaca, New York, public schools, 1906-1950.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Papers include professional correspondence with colleagues, publishers, and others concerning the textbooks on which she collaborated with Hollis Dann and later Katherine Knapp (Let's Read Music: 1949), conferences of music educators, and her teaching career in general; personal letters from former students, friends, and family; and diaries (incomplete run) and notebooks. Also, scrapbooks of press notices concerning her own activities and other clippings relating to former students, Cornell personalities, and numerous other persons and subjects; Ithaca High School concert programs (2 vols., 1901-50), Cornell Dramatic Club programs (1925+), and Cornell music programs (1915+); Ithaca High School Choral Club correspondence and newspaper clippings (1923-40), miscellaneous concert and theater programs (1903+), and verse and lyrics. Also, unmounted programs and scores from Cornell Music Festivals (1907-20); albums of photographs and picture postcards, as well as substantial numbers of loose photographs, postcards, musical scores, and clippings; student grade books and roll books, reports, bulletins, music teachers' magazines, and other publications, and miscellaneous materials relating to her teaching in Ithaca schools and in summer sessions at Cornell, San Francisco State College, Utah State Agricultural College, Louisiana State University, and elsewhere; items pertaining to the Bryant family and to Miss Bryant's study and early work in Indiana, and other items.
Includes correspondence from Karin White and other members of the White and Magill families.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Laura Bryant papers, #2112. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook containing press cuttings on old students, programs, etc.
Scrapbook and two manilla folders containing correspondence in connection with Reader's Digest article, Sept. 1960 (Biography sketches on Laura Bryant)
Medal: Veterans of Foreign Wars Annual Citizanship Award, 1959
Postcards and correspondence pertaining to Music Educators National Conference in Washington, 1961
Personal and professional letters up to 1960 (to and from students, old students, etc.)
Package containing own school report ( 1900 ) and reports on students at Cornell summer session, 1920
Three students' notebooks, two for 1915 , one for 1918
Records of Royalties received from sale of books
Press cuttings in connection with members of Choral Club
Bundle of correspondence dated from 1926-1936 private and professional, it contains letters from Hollis Dan, the Dean of Cornell, various other universities
Letters from Karin White and Beatrice Magill
Twenty-two photographs (including one of Mrs. Andrew White)
Photograph of teachers, Laura Bryant in front row

Postcard-sized photograph of Miss Bryant and Helen Magill White standing by fountain with pigeons in foreground; St. Mark's Square, Venice, 1921? (uncertain whether it is first or second trip to Europe)
Interior photo of Basilica of San Francesco d'Assisi
Scores and programs from Cornell Music Festivals, 1907-1920

Miscellaneous magazines, including "The Music Bulletin," Apr. 1926 , which contains as article by Hollis Dan; a copy of "American Education," June 1912 , which contains an article by Frank Boynton, then Ithaca Superintendent of Schools
Program for dedication of Anabel Taylor Hall, 1952
Press cuttings pertaining to own graduation and photogrpah
Indiana State University Commencement Week program, 1949 , and B.A. diploma
Cards and correspondence, labelled "Guerlac," dated between 1953 and 1954
Scrapbook containing programs from Ithaca High School concerts, May 1934-May 1950
Scrapbook dated 1923 , "Choral Club Volume II," includes letters and press cuttings to 1940
Scrapbook containing programs of local concerts, 1903-1915
Scrapbook containing programs of general nature, 1913-1925
Scrapbook containing press cuttings, chiefly pertaining to Cornell personalities and self, from 1924
Scrapbook containing press cuttings of old pupils, 1940-
Scrapbook containing Cornell Dramatic Club programs, 1925-
Scrapbook containing Ithaca High School programs, 1901-1933
Two scrapbooks containing Cornell Music programs, 1915-
Book: "Your Boy Samuel," a collection of Civil War Letters, private printing
Leather folder containing photographs of Hollis Dann
Postcards and correspondence from ex Ithaca High students, 1918
Miscellaneous European and American postcards, 1923- (including one to Mrs. Andrew White)
Cuttings from "The New York State School Music News," Feb. 1959 (about her)
Album of Thanksgiving Day concert photographs, 1958
Membership card N.Y. State School Music Association, 1959-1960
Typed pamphlet issued by Metropolitan Opera Guild, Mar. 1960
Diploma, "National Education Association" as an active member for life, 1927
Annual Reports of Ithaca Schools Music, 1926
Correspondence and instructions for a "Specialist in Physical Development" re prevention of sagging face muscle, 1918
Cutting from "School and Society," Apr. 1935 L.B. mentioned)
Postcards, programs, etc., from Munich festival, 1928
Six folders containing miscellaneous professional and personal correspondence, 1928-
Box file containing miscellaneous professional and personal correspondence, 1924-
Box file containing miscellaneous personal correspondence, 1929-1939 (Clare Kimmel)
Box file containing correspondence pertaining to her books, 1926-1935 , with American Book Co.
Tin box containing autographs, press cuttings, 1912 Glee Club
Program (2) of Eastern Music Supervisor's Conference, 1935 (L.B. President)
Magazines, 1953 , 1957 , 1959 , containing articles of personal (professional) interest
Diary of second trip to Europe
Two cardboard boxes containing photographs and greeting cards, 1953-1957
Bundle of letters wirtten from 1914-1919 by Hollis Dann
Letters, photographs, etc., and obituary on William Ballard, 1952
"The Music Bulletin," article by Hollis Dann, Apr. 1926
Press cuttings, correspondence, pertaining to Glee Club, 1933
2 files on Utah, programs etc., correspondence, 1952
Letters from Willis Music Co. re "Lets Read Music"
Envelope containing further letters from Hollis Dann, 1922-1923
Duplicate of Teacher's Certificate (State of N.Y.)
Photostat of final draft of Reader's Digest article prior to publication
Five copies of "Eastern School Music Herald," 1922-1923
Personal receipts (money matters, Hollis Dann loan)
Copy of "Le Journal Musical Francais," Apr. 1955
Candy box containing letters from Hollis Dann, 1924
Letters of condolence on death of nephew John Kimmel, 1937
Final letters from Hollis Dann and letters from his family on his death
Two files containing literary exercises (outline and crits.)
Box from Tiffany's containing personal correspondence, 1950-
Teacher's license, issued by the State of Indiana, Aug. 27, 1898 , Feb. 27, 1897 , May 27, 1899 , Mar. 31, 1900
Correspondence from Dann's family, re commencing fund in his name, 1939-
Miscellaneous personal and professional correspondence, mainly 1940's-1950's
Collection of early photographs (including one of a big concert, Laura Bryant and Hollis Dann prominent)
Several files of personal correspondence, filed under name of writer, 1930-
Papers (speeches?) on the tuition of singing
Correspondence, personal and professional, on retirement
Primer, simple sclaes by Hollis Dann
Primer, second year music by Hollis Dann
Book of Anthems from Indiana State School, 1900
